title: paladin
description: A job application manager from the applicant's POV. I built this project with Sveltekit, ExpressJS, Lucia and MongoDB. The project required a lot of state flow between the frontend application and database and overall it offers great user experience and user interface.

title: hermes logistics
description: An efficient platform developed to streamline logistics management. Hermes Logistics provides an efficient platform for managing logistics operations. The application covers a wide range of services such as storage, handling, transportation, and expedited deliveries. Designed to streamline logistics management, it ensures timely deliveries and effective tracking of parcels and shipments.

title: CSS unit converter
description: A VS Code extension that converts CSS unit directly within the editor. It is designed to simplify CSS development by providing quick and easy unit conversions directly within your code editor by displaying them in hover cards or comments beside the code.
stackReason: I used TypeScript so I can get a easy development process. Since this was my very first trial of building an extension, the lasting I need is having issues with JavaScript not co-operating with innocent me! :). Hence, I needed a languag that ensures type safety, predicatability while ensuring ease of development.
purpose: I have always wanted to see the equivalent of the css units I have in my code and the only thing I know is 1rem = 16px, what about 2.4rem? looool no, I can't start calculating every now and then. So I built me a css unit converter. It is basic and it does what it's supposed to do simply: show your css units in other unit values. This extension supports units like pixels (px), ems (em), rems (rem).
problems: The VS Code API was daunting! I had to read and read more, endlessly! Likewise, I didn't know what to type on Google to solve the challenges I encountered as I did this!
lessons: Aside from building my first extension, I learnt that I can really write some couple of code to automate/ease my development process, hence, illustrating the exact purpose of technology in humanity!
